00022 /* standard includes. */
00023 #include <getopt.h>
00024 #include <stdio.h>
00025 #include <stdlib.h>
00026 #include <unistd.h>
00027 #include <string.h>
00028 
00029 #include <netinet/in.h>
00030 
00031 /* local defines. */
00032 #define DEFAULT_PORT 4567       /* default port. */
00033 #define DEFAULT_HOST INADDR_ANY /* default host. (all addresses). */
00034 
00035 /* my includes. */
00036 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00037 #include "program_messages.h"
00038 
00039 /* the name of the executable. */
00040 static const char *program_name = NULL;
00041 
00042 /* the input environment variable. */
00043 const char *environment_input = NULL;
00044 
00045 /* command line arguments. */
00046 static options_info input_options;
00047 options_info *fop = &input_options;
00048 
00049 /* function prototypes. */
00050 static void print_usage (FILE *, cint);
00051 static void options_init (void);
00052 void parse_options (int, char **);
00053 
00054 /* functions. */
00055 /* the following function is used to report the
00056    usage of the program and where to send bugs. */
00057 static void
00058 print_usage (FILE * stream, cint exit_code)
00059 {
00060   fprintf (stream, "%s %s %s\n", usage_part_a, program_name, usage_part_b);
00061   fprintf (stream, "\n%s%s%s\n", usage_part_c, usage_part_d, usage_part_e);
00062   fprintf (stream, "%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00063 
00064   exit (exit_code);
00065 }
00066 
00067 /* the following function sets default values
00068    for all command line arguments and options. */
00069 static void
00070 options_init (void)
00071 {
00072   /* for the program. */
00073   fop->verbose = false;
00074   fop->input_filename = NULL;
00075   fop->high_randomness = false;
00076 
00077   /* for the server. */
00078   fop->port = (uint16_t) htons (DEFAULT_PORT);
00079   fop->local_address.s_addr = DEFAULT_HOST;
00080   fop->ip_timestamp = false;
00081 }
00082 
00083 /* the following function parses
00084    input command line arguments. */
00085 void
00086 parse_options (int argc, char **argv)
00087 {
00088   /* extern necessary elements. */
00089   extern char *strdup (const char *);
00090   extern bool ascii_file (const char *);
00091   extern char *program_invocation_short_name;
00092 
00093   /* the next option to get. */
00094   int next_option;
00095 
00096   /* short options. */
00097   unique short_options = "i:rp:vt";
00098 
00099   /* long options. */
00100   const struct option long_options[] = {
00101     {"input", 1, NULL, 'i'},
00102     {"high-randomness", 0, NULL, 'r'},
00103     {"port", 1, NULL, 'p'},
00104     {"verbose", 0, NULL, 'v'},
00105     {"ip-timestamp", 0, NULL, 't'},
00106     {"help", 0, NULL, 'h'},
00107     {"usage", 0, NULL, 'u'},
00108     {"version", 0, NULL, 'V'},
00109     {NULL, 0, NULL, 0}
00110   };
00111 
00112   /* get the command program name. */
00113   program_name = program_invocation_short_name;
00114 
00115   /* fetch input environment filename. */
00116   environment_input = getenv ("GTRM_SERVER_INPUT");
00117 
00118   /* set default values. */
00119   options_init ();
00120 
00121   /* start scanning. */
00122   do
00123     {
00124       /* get next option. */
00125       next_option =
00126         getopt_long (argc, argv, short_options, long_options, NULL);
00127 
00128       switch (next_option)
00129         {
00130           /* print usage and exit. */
00131         case 'h':
00132         case 'u':
00133           print_usage (stdout, EXIT_SUCCESS);
00134 
00135           /* print version and exit. */
00136         case 'V':
00137           printf ("%s %s\n", package_msg, version_msg);
00138           printf ("%s %s\n", written_by_msg, developers_msg);
00139           printf ("\n%s", license_part_a);
00140           printf ("%s\n", license_part_b);
00141           printf ("%s\n", license_part_c);
00142           printf ("%s\n", reportbugs_msg);
00143           exit (EXIT_SUCCESS);
00144 
00145           /* user specified port. */
00146         case 'p':
00147           {
00148             long value;
00149             char *end;
00150 
00151             value = strtol (optarg, &end, 10);
00152 
00153             /* correct port value? */
00154             if (*end != '\0' || value <= 0 || value <= 1024)
00155               {
00156                 fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", port_limits);
00157                 print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00158               }
00159 
00160             /* the port number needs to be converted
00161                to network (big endian) byte order. */
00162             fop->port = (uint16_t) htons (value);
00163           }
00164           break;
00165 
00166           /* enable verbose mode. */
00167         case 'v':
00168           fop->verbose = true;
00169           break;
00170 
00171           /* enable ip timestamp writing mode. */
00172         case 't':
00173           fop->ip_timestamp = true;
00174           break;
00175 
00176           /* enable high quality randomness. */
00177         case 'r':
00178           fop->high_randomness = true;
00179           break;
00180 
00181         case 'i':
00182           /* fetch input filename. */
00183           fop->input_filename = strdup (optarg);
00184 
00185           /* is the file a regular ascii file? */
00186           if (!ascii_file (fop->input_filename))
00187             {
00188               fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", input_file_limits_a);
00189               fprintf (stderr, "%s `%s':\n", input_file_limits_b,
00190                        fop->input_filename);
00191               fprintf (stderr, "%s\n\n", regular_file_limits);
00192               print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00193             }
00194           break;
00195 
00196           /* unknown option. */
00197         case '?':
00198           print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00199 
00200           /* no more options. */
00201         case -1:
00202           break;
00203 
00204         default:
00205           abort ();
00206         }
00207     }
00208   while (next_option != -1);
00209 
00210   /* the program does not take additional arguments. */
00211   if (optind != argc)
00212     {
00213       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n\n", additional_arguments);
00214       print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00215     }
00216 
00217   /* is there any input filename? */
00218   if ((fop->input_filename == NULL) && (environment_input == NULL))
00219     {
00220       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n\n", input_file_is_missing);
00221       print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00222     }
00223 
00224   /* if the input file was given by `-i'
00225      then go to the body of the program.
00226      Otherwise, check to see if the input
00227      environment variable is ok. */
00228   if (fop->input_filename != NULL)
00229     return;
00230   else if (!ascii_file (environment_input))
00231     {
00232       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n", environment_file_limits_a);
00233       fprintf (stderr, "%s `%s':\n", environment_file_limits_b,
00234                environment_input);
00235       fprintf (stderr, "%s\n\n", regular_file_limits);
00236       print_usage (stderr, EXIT_FAILURE);
00237     }
00238 }
